greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of (chi(x) / chi(-x^6))^2 in powers of x where chi() is a Ramanujan theta function.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (36 t)) = 1/2 g(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t) and g() is g.f. for A328797.
link: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of q^(-5/12) * (eta(q^2)^2 * eta(q^12))^2 / (eta(q) * eta(q^4) * eta(q^6))^2 in power of q.
mathematica: a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ (QPochhammer[ -x, x^2] QPochhammer[ -x^6, x^6])^2, {x, 0, n}];
program: (PARI) {a(n) = my(A); if( n < 0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( (eta(x^2 + A)^2 * eta(x^12 + A))^2 / (eta(x + A) * eta(x^4 + A) * eta(x^6 + A))^2, n))};
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Oct 27 2019
